messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:07): wow, look at the UA string
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:07): what the hell is that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:08): Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.0; Trident/4.0;
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:08): SLCC1; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; Media Center PC 5.0; InfoPath.2; .NET CLR 3.5.21022;
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:08): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: fortunately, IE9 no longer exposes the junk to HTTP
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:08): what's the point of all of it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:09): I believe all that is still in navigator.userAgent even in IE9, though my memory may be failing me
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:09): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: everyone wants to have a piece of the UA string to proclaim their existence
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:10): I'm in the UA string, therefore, I am. -- Descartes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:10): well, in aggregate, it's certainly proclaiming something
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:11): certainly not proclaiming w hat they intended
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:12): anyway, I do like bug reports that have phrases such as "threatens to undermine the future"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:13): though personally I would go with something more like "threatens to destroy the entire fabric of all we hold dear"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:18): I wonder what they worshipped before well-formedness became God
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:20): I think that was always a pretty small cult
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:20): because the initiation rituals were so complicated
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:20): Did HyTime use Architectural Forms?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:21): regardless, they were cut out of the same cloth
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:21): Architectural Forms is an awesome name, BTW
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:21): should be repurposed for something good
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:26): Using an SGML architecture, documents would instead be required to begin with something like the following processing instruction:
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:26): Yes, because the doctype wasn't hard enough to remember
